title: The Judge’s Breath
description: Up the Whispering Aqueduct's spine, the Sunken Steppe Terraces lift their faces toward the river like hungry children. The bell-strings have been cut in the night before a weighing festival that will call the River Judge, an old rite that measures a city's debts in water. Rae Fen asks you to secure the lines, defend the bell-ringers, and bring the truth of the bleed-valves to a ritual that turns lies to brine. If the Judge rises and hears silence, nothing good will follow back downstream.
objectives: Travel upriver to the seventh terrace and meet Rae Fen at the bell shrine.
Repair or replace the severed bell-strings before flood-swell.
Present evidence of hidden bleed-valves gathered in M2 and M4 during the rite.
Protect the bell-ringers from saboteurs during the ceremony.
Assist Ys Hul in sanctifying a temporary rebalancing of sluice gates.
Escort the procession’s testimony to be recorded at the Aethral Archive.

dialogue.speaker: Rae Fen
dialogue.line: I learned to hear my name in pipes, and now the river is saying the city's name through my teeth. The bell-strings were cut by hands that know how to climb wet stone and how to hide ink under seals. Help me tie them again, and help me ring something truer than hunger.

dialogue.speaker: Ys Hul
dialogue.line: We will call the Judge with sound and with silence, in balance, as the terraces taught us. Bring your ledger of bribes, bring your map of valves, and bring your courage. The river does not mind if we are afraid, so long as we are honest about it.

dialogue.speaker: Thalen Vire
dialogue.line: I have names written in hush-ink and silt under my nails. I'll ring the measure the old empire carved and hold the line if raiders try to cut it again. If the Judge asks what the city owes, I will answer: we owe upstream breath, not excuses.

dialogue.speaker: Orven Caldris
dialogue.line: Public rites make poor policy and worse contracts. We can restructure flows without theater and without humiliating the city in front of its granaries. Return to your charts; leave the debt to those of us who can carry it without crying to river ghosts.

dialogue.speaker: Rae Fen
dialogue.line: You can carry coin, Mask, but can you carry thirst? The Judge knows the difference. Stand aside, or stand with us. Either way, the bells will ring.

rewards: River Judge's Bead (badge granting respect and audience in terrace villages)
+1 standing with the Choir of Silt and terrace communities
Archive Seal permitting you to file testimony without a Ledger clerk
